name: High Protein Chocolate Cookie Dough Banana Bread
description: Protein-Packed Banana Bread with Cookie Dough Layer
ingredients: 1/4 cup maple syrup or sugar-free syrup
1 cup oat flour (or finely ground oats)
1/2 cup chocolate protein powder (whey or plant-based)
1/2 cup vanilla protein powder (cookie dough layer)
2 tablespoons powdered peanut butter/PB2 (cookie dough layer)
2 tablespoons unsweetened almond milk (cookie dough layer)
1 tablespoon sugar-free maple syrup (cookie dough layer)
1 tablespoon mini chocolate chips (cookie dough layer)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F and line a 9×5-inch loaf pan with parchment paper; lightly spray with oil
In a large bowl, whisk together the bananas, eggs, Greek yogurt, almond milk, syrup, and vanilla until smooth
In another bowl, mix the oat flour, chocolate protein powder, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt
Add the dry mixture to the wet ingredients and stir until just combined; fold in chocolate chips if using
In a small bowl, mix vanilla protein powder, almond flour, powdered peanut butter, almond milk, maple syrup, and mini chocolate chips until a soft dough forms (add more almond milk if needed)
Pour half the banana batter into the loaf pan
Crumble or spread the cookie dough layer on top
Pour remaining batter over it and smooth the top
Bake for 40–45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out mostly clean
Let cool 15 minutes in the pan, then remove and cool fully before slicing
